content.question: Compared with a historian espousing the more traditional view of the Industrial Revolution as a truly transformative event, de Vries would be more likely to emphasize the importance of all of the following EXCEPT

choices.label: the freeing of labor and capital from traditional restraints as a result of the breakdown of guild regulations
the increases in the size of the manufacturing workforce brought about by the growth of cottage industry
the growing demand for manufactured goods as part of the Consumer Revolution
the greater ability of inventors to profit from their inventions due to government support

content.answer: the greater ability of inventors to profit from their inventions due to government support

topic.text: 6.2: The Spread of Industry Throughout Europe

skill.text: Skill 3.C: Compare the arguments or main ideas of two sources.
